comment.author: 95271015@N00
comment._content:
I don't know where this is, but here is information from maritime historian Norman Brouwer as to what this is:

Built in Greenpoint, Brooklyn in 1877 for excursions in New York Harbor.  260 feet.  Later an excursion steamboat on Chesapeake Bay as the PRESIDENT.  Used by the Shipping Board as a Recruiting Service receiving ship at Norfolk 1917-1918.  After World War I a towed excursion barge at Philadelphia.  Abandoned at Camden, New Jersey in 1925.
